_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Golden State Foods - Opelika, AL

Risk Management Program

Executive Summary

 

This Executive Summary has been prepared to demonstrate how Golden State Foods - Opelika complies with the requirements set forth under EPA's Chemical Accidental Prevention Provisions (40 CFR Part 68).  

 This plan has been developed specifically to address the requirements applicable to the use of anhydrous ammonia at Golden State Foods - Opelika located in Opelika, AL. Each of the following sections provides a general overview of the requirements and defines the design attributes, documentation, and actions that are established to comply with those requirements.  In most instances, Golden State Foods - Opelika has already developed measures and systems that provide compliance with 40 CFR Part 68 rules as a result of other regulatory programs and requirements.  This document does not replicate that information but rather provides cross-references to the applicable existing documentation.  In those instances where information was developed specifically to comply with the Part 68 requirements, that information is contained in this document.

 Corporate Commitment to Safety

Golden State Foods - Opelika is committed in providing to all employees a work environment that is free from recognized health and safety hazards.  Accordingly, our goal is achieving and sustaining safety through communication, information, and training.  To this end, we are dedicated to the concept that all employees receive the proper orientation and are provided with the means necessary to ensure the environment remains as safe and healthful as possible.

 

It is the policy of Golden State Foods - Opelika to:

Provide safe working conditions, proper tools, and personal protective equipment.

Comply with all federal, state, and local occupational health, safety, and environmental laws and regulations.

Provide and sustain a high level of commitment to ensure all employees have a safe and healthy work environment i

n which to work.

Ensure, through training, and when necessary disciplinary action, that all employees work in a safe manner.

Educate and/or train all employees in safe work practices, and ensure that each employee fully understands his or her job, equipment, techniques, and methods to reduce the risk to himself or herself and their co-workers.

 Encourage all employees to "Think Safety", so that safety habits developed and practiced at work carry through to non-work related activities.

Golden State Foods - Opelika's aim is to provide a professional service as efficiently as possible while minimizing the use of toxic materials wherever and whenever prudent.  In this effort, our highest priority will be the proactive pursuit of cost-effective process changes that reduce or eliminate the use and/or generation of hazardous toxics at the endpoint of service.  Where hazardous toxics cannot be eliminated, improving controls to handle these substances will be explored and implemented wherever possible.

 Golden State Foods - Opelika has prepared a facility safety policy and procedures program specifically tailored for the facility. In addition, a Process Safety Management Program has also been established and implemented regarding the ammonia refrigeration system process.  It is the responsibility of the designated facility personnel to carry out these programs.

 The first duty of Golden State Foods - Opelika employees is to exercise care in the performance of his/her work tasks to prevent an accident to him/herself, co-workers, the general public or equipment.  Safety-consciousness must take precedence over expedience, and is required as a condition of continued employment of all employees at all levels of the organization.

 Golden State Foods - Opelika Facility Description

Golden State Foods is a domestic producer of processed food products. The Golden State Foods - Opelika, AL plant site covers approximately 165,493 square feet within the Opelika, AL city limits. I

t is located at 4801 North Park Drive in Opelika, AL, Lee County.  The facility employees approximately 285 personnel.  The facility uses Anhydrous Ammonia in the "Refrigeration System".

Accidental release program & chemical-specific prevention steps

The substance regulated under the Chemical Accident Prevention Provisions (40 CFR 68) that is located on site, in various locations and quantities is anhydrous ammonia.  Anhydrous ammonia is utilized on site for the "Refrigeration System."  The ammonia is contained in various vessels, piping, condensers and evaporators used throughout the ammonia refrigeration system.  

Golden State Foods has completed it Process Hazard Analysis (PHA) of the ammonia refrigeration system.  

5 year accident history - Is a new facility so it does not have a 5 year history.

Golden State Foods has not had an accidental release of ammonia that resulted in an onsite injury or adversely affected the community.

Golden State Foods' Emergency Action Plan (EAP) has been designed to address and mitigate the likely incidents that might arise from our refrigeration system. The EAP is a vital part of our overall prevention program.
